page.title: 18POPULATION CHANGE,DRAYTON.
page.content: In recent years Drayton and Taverham have been at the centre of a {significant change in the population of East Anglia.People have moved to the area for a variety of reasons and from a variey of places.Most had moved from other parts of Norfolk,some moving as they preferred a more rural setting,some for family reasons and the majority moving to be nearer their jobs in{Norwich.}Whilst being within easy reach of Norwich,this area is also conveniently close to the {airport,}the{oil and gas rigs}in the North Sea and the{R.A.F. stations}that proliferate in this part of the country.Most of the newcomers are in management of one sort or another, which reflects not only the mobility of the middle classes but also the trend in economic growth which is centred around service industries.
